author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Air, Rail and Road Travellers Federation has appealed to the Railway Ministry to operate a new day time intercity express from Tiruchi to Bengaluru.

It has sought a weekly train from Chennai to Tiruchi and back to clear the weekend rush. Resolutions to this effect were adopted at the federation’s executive committee meeting held here recently presided over by its president M. Sekaran.

Restoration of the Pallavan Express to Tiruchi in the absence of coach maintenance facility at Karaikudi; restoration of the Tiruchi – Pune Express; stoppage of all trains at Tiruverambur; realignment of the Tiruchi Railway Division by including Manapparai, Pudukottai and Karur; operation of a new train in the name of Kalam Express from Rameswaram to New Delhi were among the other demands of the Federation.
title: Travellers’ federation’s wish list on rail budget
